com.netflix.zeno.fastblob
Class FastBlobHeapFriendlyClientFrameworkSerializer

java.lang.Object
  com.netflix.zeno.serializer.FrameworkSerializer<FastBlobSerializationRecord>
      com.netflix.zeno.fastblob.FastBlobFrameworkSerializer
          com.netflix.zeno.fastblob.FastBlobHeapFriendlyClientFrameworkSerializer

public class FastBlobHeapFriendlyClientFrameworkSerializer
extends FastBlobFrameworkSerializer

Rather than adding objects to a serialization state and having the ByteArrayOrdinalMap assign ordinals, during a double snapshot refresh, we must determine the ordinal of an object based on its deserialization state's == mapping.

This class overrides the appropriate methods to inject this functionality.

Recursively call the framework to serialize the speicfied Object, then serialize the resulting ordinal as a variable-byte integer.

Description copied from class: FastBlobFrameworkSerializer
Serialize a list. The framework is used to recursively serialize each of the list's elements, then the ordinals are encoded as a sequence of variable-byte integers.

Overrides:
serializeList in class FastBlobFrameworkSerializer

public <T> void serializeSet(FastBlobSerializationRecord rec,
                             java.lang.String fieldName,
                             java.lang.String typeName,
                             java.util.Set<T> set)
Description copied from class: FastBlobFrameworkSerializer
Serialize a set. The framework is used to recursively serialize each of the set's elements, then the ordinals are encoded as a sequence of gap-encoded variable-byte integers.

Overrides:
serializeSet in class FastBlobFrameworkSerializer

serializeMap

public <K,V> void serializeMap(FastBlobSerializationRecord rec,
                               java.lang.String fieldName,
                               java.lang.String keyTypeName,
                               java.lang.String valueTypeName,
                               java.util.Map<K,V> map)
Description copied from class: FastBlobFrameworkSerializer
Serialize a Map. The framework is used to recursively serialize the map's keys and values, then the Map's entries are each encoded as a variable-byte integer for the key's ordinal, and a gap-encoded variable-byte integer for the value's ordinal.

Overrides:
serializeMap in class FastBlobFrameworkSerializer
